titles: Plain dealing or a fair vvarning to the gentlemen of the Committee for Union : in a letter intended to Alderman Foulks, to be communicated unto them accordingly at Gurney House, or elsewhere. / Written by a friend to the Parliament, City and kingdom, and for their vindication, is now published to the world.
author: Adams, Thomas, Sir, 1586-1668.
date: Printed in the first year of the Agitators raign, MDCXLVII. [1647]
notes: A friend to the Parliament = Sir Thomas Adams, whose initials appear as A.T. on p.8.
The union referred to in title is between Parliament and the City of London.
Annotations on Thomason copy: "By maior Tho: Adams"; "Nou: 17 1647".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: England and Wales. --  Parliament --  Early works to 1800.
Great Britain --  History --  Civil War, 1642-1649 --  Early works to 1800.
